comments:
Hi!
When I'm writing long (> 1000 lines) JSP-pages in Eclipse I get a nullpointer exception and after that my IDE starts "reverse writing". My log looks like this:



!ENTRY org.eclipse.wst.sse.core 4 4 2006-04-12 13:56:38.103

*** Bug 139895 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

My offhand guess is this has root cause in GenericPositionManager and the NPE there. I suspect that's being accessed for some "auto edit" insert? And some threading issues arrise ... expecially with large documents? (and fast typers? :) 

Which version do you see this in? 1.0.2? Or 1.5 RC1? Or ... ?

(In reply to comment #2)
> My offhand guess is this has root cause in GenericPositionManager and the NPE
> there. I suspect that's being accessed for some "auto edit" insert? And some
> threading issues arrise ... expecially with large documents? (and fast typers?
> :) 
> Which version do you see this in? 1.0.2? Or 1.5 RC1? Or ... ? 

Hm, must check at work but im running Eclipse 3.1. In particular it happens when I'm trying to cut and paste in large documents.

Yes, I have the same problem. I usually encounter the problem when I am doing a lot of fast copying and pasting. Even just having 20 characters in the copy buffer will do it.

I am running the Web Tools Platform 1.5 (which is Eclipse 3.2) on Windows XP Sp2 on an Athlon 3800+ X2. This is my home computer.

I do not have the same problem on my work computer. I will say that my work computer is not a dual core/dual processor machine, so any threading problems may be "hidden".
Seems to be fixed in Eclipse 3.2.
This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP bugs which are in the resolved state without an appropriate targeted version.  If you feel this bug was closed inappropriately, please reopen.
